content: Hi. I am not too sure what happened either, so sorry if the details are a bit vague. I am using VS Code as usual and opening a lean file, with nothing but a import data.nat.basic and a simple example (with sorry sindie), but then it suddenly started lagging, and not showing any info on the lean info screen on the right. Then I looked at the bottom left corner, and it says "Lean: 163386 (checking project files)". Any idea what might be happening? It is also using 700% CPU in my top.

You're compiling mathlib. Assuming you've got leanproject installed you should be able to fix it by going into the root directory of your project and typing leanproject get-mathlib. This downloads fully compiled binaries from the internet.
Ohh ok, I will try that. So that means lean compiles the .lean files into a binary or something? (I don't know much about the internals)
